messages.content: Labour has failed to stand up to the Government over its plans for a hard Brexit. Instead, on the crucial vote in Parliament, Labour MPs sided with UKIP to let the Tories press ahead with their plans for a destructive Brexit. A Labour vote this time will not stop the damaging hard Brexit.

The Liberal Democrats are fighting the hard Brexit: The Liberal Democrats are determined to fight to keep Britain in the single market. Labour MPs have openly backed the damaging hard Brexit. Voting Labour won't change anything. But a Lib Dem vote can get a strong group of MPs committed to challenging the Tory hard Brexit. Lib Dems have ruled out a coalition with either Theresa May or Jeremy Corbyn. They are the only party capable of stopping the hard Brexit - and fighting to protect jobs.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Liberal Democrats are determined to keep Britain in the single market and fight against the hard Brexit supported by Labour and the Tories.

issues.brexitEurope: The Liberal Democrats are determined to fight to keep Britain in the single market. Labour MPs have openly backed the damaging hard Brexit.

quotes.text: "Labour's leading Brexiteer explains why it MUST be a 'hard' Brexit for Britain."
"Corbyn doesn't ask a single question about Brexit. On the day Article 50 is triggered, the Labour leader neglects to prime the Prime Minister to account."
"Jeremy Corbyn has betrayed us over Brexit. He is unfit to be called leader of the opposition."
"The Liberal Democrats have vowed to fight on to retain single market membership after Brexit, after Labour was accused of throwing in the towel."
